Detailed Description

A string type designed for storing and manipulating UTF-8 encoded text.

Note
This object expects input text to already be UTF-8 encoded. For functions to convert encodings see UnicodeOperations.hpp

The UTF8String data type is used extensively throughout ChaosCore and other Chaos Foundation projects.

ChaosCore stands by the principle that all string handling should be Unicode aware. The char primitive should only be used for storing and manipulation raw byte data, not for representing entire language characters. Furthermore ChaosCore considers UTF-8 to be the only default encoding type for Unicode text. Other encodings should only be used for special cases or interacting with applications that require a different encoding (such as the Windows API). For more info see http://utf8everywhere.org/

For practicality the internal byte of an UTF8String is NULL terminated. This means the raw data can easily be used as native C style strings.

A Brief Introduction to UTF-8

In order to fully make use of the UTF8String type's functionality its useful to understand the UTF-8 encoding method.

UTF-8 encodes each Unicode symbol in 1-4 bytes. The value of each symbol maps directly to a Unicode code point that represents the symbol. For example:

  • "a" is stored using one byte with the hex value 0x61 or binary value 01100001
  • "ל" is stored using two bytes with the hex value 0xD79C or binary value 11010111 10011100
  • "∑" is stored using three bytes with the hex value 0xE28891 or binary value 11100010 10001000 10010001
  • "𝄞" is stored using four bytes with the hex value 0xF09D849E or binary value 11110000 10011101 10000100 10011110

The byte size of a UTF-8 symbol can be recognised by the bit pattern that makes up the start of each byte:

  • One byte symbol: 0xxxxxxx
  • Two byte symbol: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • Three byte symbol: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
  • Four byte symbol: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
UTF8String Usage

Here follows an example of using the UTF8String type:

We have a C style string that cannot be encoded correctly with ASCII (In this case we are assuming the input string is encoded in UTF-8):

const char* cstring = "aל∑";

If we inspect the length of the string we get unexpected results:

strlen( cstring );
// output: 6

This is because while the string only contains 3 symbols it contains 6 bytes which is what strlen is counting. Next we construct a UTF8String using the c string data, and inspect it's length:

chaos::uni::UTF8String utf8( cstring );
utf8.get_length();
// output: 3
utf8.get_byte_length()
// output: 6

[TODO: iterator] We can now inspect each symbol in the string:

for ( std::size_t i = 0; i < utf8.get_length(); ++i )
{
chaos::uni::UTF8String symbol( utf8.get_symbol( i ) );
}

Note that the symbol is returned as an UTF8String itself, this is due to the fact that symbol has a variable byte-width so cannot be stored in a char, nor is there any need to differentiate data types between a string of symbols and an individual symbol.

We can also inspect the byte-widths of each symbol in our string:

for ( std::size_t i = 0; i < utf8.get_length(); ++i )
{
utf8.get_symbol_width( i );
}
// output: 1
// output: 2
// output: 3

The UTF8String class provides many convenience functions for manipulating string data, such as split, trim, starts_with, find_first, to_raw, to_stdstring, etc.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

chaos::uni::UTF8String::UTF8String ( )

Default constructor.

Creates a new UTF8String that contains no symbols and holds only the NULL terminator.

chaos::uni::UTF8String::UTF8String ( const char *  data)

C style string constructor.

Creates a new UTF8String that contains the provided data.

Note
The input data is expected to be UTF-8 encoded and NULL terminated. For functions to convert encodings see UnicodeOperations.hpp
chaos::uni::UTF8String::UTF8String ( const char *  data,
std::size_t  length 
)

C style string and length constructor.

Creates a new UTF8String using the given number of bytes from the data.

Note
The input data is expected to be UTF-8 encoded but does not need to be NULL terminated. For functions to convert encodings see UnicodeOperations.hpp
Parameters
dataCharacter data to be used for this UTF8String.
lengthThe number of bytes to read from the character data.
chaos::uni::UTF8String::UTF8String ( const UTF8String &  other)

Copy constructor.

Creates a new UTF8String from a copy of the data from the given other UTF8String.

const UTF8String& chaos::uni::UTF8String::operator= ( const UTF8String &  other)

Assignment operator.

Assigns the internal of data this UTF8String as a copy from the internal data of the provided UTF8String.

Is the same as calling assign( const UTF8String& ).

Parameters
otherUTF8String to copy internal data from.
Returns
A reference to this UTF8String after the assignment has taken place.

bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::operator< ( const UTF8String &  other) const

Less than operator.

Compares whether this UTF8String is less than the other given UTF8String.

Less than is defined by performing a value comparison between each Unicode code point in the string.

Parameters
otherUTF8String to compare against.
Returns
Whether this UTF8String is less than the other.
UTF8String chaos::uni::UTF8String::operator+ ( const UTF8String &  other) const

Addition operator.

Performs the same function as concatenate() but does not cause any modifications to this string, instead returns a new string which contains the results of the concatenation.

Parameters
otherUTF8String to append to the end of a copy of this string.
Returns
UTF8String that contains the results of the concatenation.

void chaos::uni::UTF8String::assign ( const char *  data)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String from the given C style string.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this UTF8String.

Note
The input data is expected to be UTF-8 encoded and NULL terminated. For functions to convert encodings see UnicodeOperations.hpp
void chaos::uni::UTF8String::assign ( const char *  data,
std::size_t  length 
)

Assigns the internal data of this UTF8String from the given C style string and byte length.

Creates a new UTF8String using the given number of bytes from the data. This operation will delete any current internal data of this UTF8String.

Note
The input data is expected to be UTF-8 encoded but does not need to be NULL terminated. For functions to convert encodings see UnicodeOperations.hpp
Parameters
dataCharacter data to be used for this UTF8String.
lengthThe number of bytes to read from the character data.
void chaos::uni::UTF8String::assign ( const UTF8String &  other)

Assigns internal data from a copy of another UTF8String.

This operation will delete any current internal data of this UTF8String.

UTF8String& chaos::uni::UTF8String::concatenate ( const UTF8String &  other)

Concatenates another UTF8String on to the end of this string.

Note
This operation modifies this UTF8String.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "Hello" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "World" );
s_1.concatenate( s_2 );
std::cout << s_1 << std::endl;
// output: Hello World

UTF8String to append to the end of this string.

Returns
A reference to this UTF8String after the concatenation has taken place.
UTF8String& chaos::uni::UTF8String::repeat ( chaos::uint32  count)

Extends this string with a copy of itself the given number of times.

Note
This operation modifies this UTF8String.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "Hello" );
s.repeat( 3 );
std::cout << s << std::endl;
// output: HelloHelloHello
Parameters
countThe number of times to repeat this string.
Returns
A reference to this UTF8String after repeat has taken place.
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::starts_with ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Checks whether this UTF8String starts with the given substring.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "Hello World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "Hello" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_3( "World" );
s_1.starts_with( s_2 ); // returns: true
s_1.starts_with( s_3 ); // returns: false
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::ends_with ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Checks whether this UTF8String ends with the given substring.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "Hello World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "Hello" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_3( "World" );
s_1.ends_with( s_2 ); // returns: false
s_1.ends_with( s_3 ); // returns: true
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::find_first ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Finds the first occurrence of the given substring and returns the symbol index of it within this UTF8String.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "Hello World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_3( "*" );
s_1.find_first( s_2 ); // returns: 6
s_1.find_first( s_3 ); // returns: chaos::uni::npos
Parameters
substringUTF8String to find the first occurrence of in this string.
Returns
The index of the beginning of the first occurrence of the substring in this string. If the substring could not be found, chaos::uni::npos is returned instead.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::find_last ( const UTF8String &  substring) const

Finds the last occurrence of the given substring and returns the index of it within this UTF8String.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "Hello World World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_3( "*" );
s_1.find_first( s_2 ); // returns: 12
s_1.find_first( s_3 ); // returns: chaos::uni::npos
Parameters
substringUTF8String to find the last occurrence of in this string.
Returns
The index of the beginning of the last occurrence of the substring in this string. If the substring could not be found, chaos::uni::npos is returned instead.
std::vector< UTF8String > chaos::uni::UTF8String::split ( const UTF8String &  delimiter) const

Splits this UTF8String by the given delimiter and returns the split elements in a std::vector.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "Hello_World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String delim( "_" );
std::vector< chaos::uni::UTF8String > elements = s.split( delim );
// vector contents: [ "Hello", "World" ]
Exceptions
chaos::ex::ValueErrorIf the provided delimiter is an empty string.
Parameters
delimiterString to use as a delimiter to split the string into elements.
Returns
std::vector containing the results of the split.
void chaos::uni::UTF8String::remove_duplicates ( const UTF8String &  substring)

Removes consecutive duplicates of the given substring within this string.

Consecutive duplicates are removed so that only one instance of the substring is retained.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "this__string--has__duplicates!!" );
s.remove_duplicates( "_" );
// s is: this_string--has_duplicates!!
Parameters
substringSubstring to remove consectituve instances of from this string.
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::is_int ( ) const

Whether the symbols of this string make up a valid integer type.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "-34" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "Hello" );
s_1.is_int(); // returns: true
s_2.is_int(); //returns: false
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::is_uint ( ) const

Whether the symbols of this string make up a valid unsigned integer type.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "16" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "-34" );
s_1.is_uint(); // returns: true
s_2.is_uint(); //returns: false
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::is_float ( ) const

Whether the symbols of this string make up a valid floating point type.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s_1( "53.89" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String s_2( "Hello" );
s_1.is_float(); // returns: true
s_2.is_float(); //returns: false
UTF8String chaos::uni::UTF8String::substring ( std::size_t  start,
std::size_t  length 
) const

Returns a new UTF8String composed of a substring of this string.

Example usage:

chaos::string::UTF8String s( "Hello World" );
s.substring( 0, 5 ); // returns: "Hello"
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided starting index is out of bounds of the string length.
Parameters
startIndex of the symbol to start the substring from. If this is equal to the length of this string an empty string is returned.
lengththe length of the substring. If greater than the possible symbols to allocate it will be clamped to the maximum length of the string with relation to the starting index.
Returns
New UTF8String containing the substring.
std::string chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_std_string ( ) const

Returns this as a standard library string.

Note
The contents of the std::string is a copy of the data within this object.
bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_bool ( ) const

Returns this UTF8String as an bool type.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the data of this string is not a valid bool.
chaos::int32 chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_int32 ( ) const

Returns this UTF8String as an int32 type.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the data of the string is not a valid int32.
chaos::uint32 chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_uint32 ( ) const

Returns this UTF8String as an uint32 type.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the data of the string is not a valid uint32.
chaos::int64 chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_int64 ( ) const

Returns this UTF8String as an int64 type.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the data of the string is not a valid int64.
chaos::int64 chaos::uni::UTF8String::to_uint64 ( ) const

Returns this UTF8String as an uint64 type.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::ConversionDataErrorIf the data of the string is not a valid uint64.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_length ( ) const

Returns the number of symbols in this UTF8String.

The length is defined as how many UTF-8 symbols there are in the string, this doesn't not necessarily equal the number of bytes in the string.

bool chaos::uni::UTF8String::is_empty ( ) const

Returns whether the this UTF8String contains any characters or not.

This operation is the same as checking whether get_length() returns 0 or not.

UTF8String chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_symbol ( std::size_t  index) const

Returns the UTF-8 symbol at the given index in this string.

The symbol is returned contained within a new UTF8String.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "Hello World" );
chaos::uni::UTF8String symbol( s.get_symbol( 6 ) );
std::cout << symbol << std::endl;
// output: W
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string length.
Parameters
indexPosition of the symbol to retrieve in this string with respect to the symbol length. See get_length()
Returns
A new UTF8String containing the single UTF-8 symbol at the given index.
chaos::uint32 chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_symbol_value ( std::size_t  index = 0) const

Returns the integer/hex value for the UTF-8 symbol at the given index in this string.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "Hello World" );
s.get_symbol_value( 6 ); // returns: 87 (0x57)
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string length.
Parameters
indexPosition of the symbol to retrieve the value for in this string with respect to the symbol length. See get_length()
Returns
A uint32 containing the value of the symbol.
chaos::uint32 chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_code_point ( std::size_t  index = 0) const

Returns the Unicode code point for the UTF-8 symbol at the given index in this string.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "Hello World©" );
s.get_symbol_value( 11 ); // returns: 169 (0xA9)
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string length.
Parameters
indexPosition of the symbol to retrieve the code point for in this string with respect to the symbol length. See get_length()
Returns
A uint32 containing the code point of the symbol.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_byte_index_for_symbol_index ( std::size_t  symbol_index) const

Gets the index of the first byte for the symbol at the given index in this string.

The symbol index is defined as the index of a symbol in the string with respect to the number of symbols in the string. See get_length(). While the byte index is defined as the index of a byte in the string with respect to the number of bytes in the string. See get_byte_length().

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "£5" );
s.get_byte_index_for_symbol_index( 0 );
// returns: 0
s.get_byte_index_for_symbol_index( 1 );
// returns: 2 (as £ is two bytes wide)
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string length.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_symbol_width ( std::size_t  index) const

Gets the number of bytes in the symbol at the given index in this string.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "£5" );
s.get_symbol_width( 0 ); // returns: 2
s.get_symbol_width( 1 ); // returns: 1
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string length.
const char* chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_raw ( ) const

Gets the raw byte data of this UTF8String.

This data is a direct pointer to the internal pointer of this UTF8String.

Warning
The returned data should not be deleted as it is a direct pointer to the internal data of this object. And it will be deleted when this UTF8String is deleted.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_byte_length ( ) const

Returns the length of the internal data in bytes.

This is exactly the number of bytes in the internal raw data of this UTF8String which can be accessed through to_raw(). Note that this data is NULL ('\0') terminated and this length includes the NULL terminator. Therefore if UTF8String == "" then get_byte_length() == 1.

Note
This is not equal to the symbol length of the string as UTF-8 encoded characters can consist of multiple bytes.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_symbol_index_for_byte_index ( std::size_t  byte_index) const

Returns the index of the symbol that the byte at the given index is part of.

The symbol index is defined as the index of a symbol in the string with respect to the number of symbols in the string. See get_length(). While the byte index is defined as the index of a byte in the string with respect to the number of bytes in the string. See get_byte_length().

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "£5" );
s.get_symbol_index_for_byte_index( 0 ); // returns 0
s.get_symbol_index_for_byte_index( 1 ); // returns 0
s.get_symbol_index_for_byte_index( 2 ); // returns 1
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string byte length.
std::size_t chaos::uni::UTF8String::get_byte_width ( std::size_t  byte_index) const

Returns the number of bytes in the symbol at the given byte index.

Example usage:

chaos::uni::UTF8String s( "£5" );
s.get_byte_width( 0 ); // returns: 2
s.get_byte_width( 2 ); // returns: 1
Warning
If the given byte index is not the start of a UTF-8 symbol this operation will return unexpected results.
Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string byte length.
